channel.title: Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge
channel.description: Recent content on Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge

item.title: Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge
item.description: Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge Since 2010, the IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy ("Oakland" conference) has included papers on Systematization of Knowledge (SoK). This paper track grew out of discussions at the NSF/IARPA/NSA Workshop on the Science of Security held at the Claremont Resort in November 2008. This site collects all the Oakland SoK papers, as well as SoK papers in IEEE European Symposium on Security and Privacy (EuroS&P, since 2017), Privacy Enhancing Technologies Symposium (PETS, since 2019), the IEEE Conference on Secure and Trustworthy Machine Learning (SatML, since 2023), and USENIX Security Symposium (since 2024).

item.title: Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge - Authors
item.description: SoK Authors Melek Önen SoK: Secure Aggregation based on cryptographic schemes for Federated Learning (PETS 2023) Ali Abbasi SoK: Security of Programmable Logic Controllers (USENIX 2024) AbdelRahman Abdou SoK: Delegation and Revocation, the Missing Links in the Web’s Chain of Trust (EuroS&P 2020) Hadi Abdullah SoK: The Faults in our ASRs: An Overview of Attacks against Automatic Speech Recognition and Speaker Identification Systems (Oakland 2021) Sharif Abuadbba SoK: Can Trajectory Generation Combine Privacy and Utility?

item.title: Systematizing Systematization of Knowledge - Other Conferences
item.description: Other Conferences with SoK Papers Since IEEE Security and Privacy started the SoK papers in 2010, several other venues have also include SoK papers. ACM Workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Security (AISec) (started in 2012, continuing) International Workshop on Genome Privacy and Security (GenoPri) (since 2014) Hardware and Architectural Support for Security and Privacy (HASP) (since 2015) IEEE European Symposium on Security and Privacy (EuroOakland) (since first edition in 2016)
